revised_title: Laboratory Measurements of Seismic Velocities in Ocean Sediments: A Study of Compressional Wave Velocities in Deep-Sea Sediments
tldr: The authors conducted laboratory experiments to measure the compressional wave velocities in samples of deep-sea sediments using ultrasonic methods. They found that a vertical gradient of velocity exists in the sedimentary layer of the ocean, which can help in understanding the physical properties of ocean sediments and their impact on seismic refraction profiles.
